TopicTitle: [Mod Request]Auto-shutdown for engines whose minThrust is above 0

Articles.Content:
I'm a RealFuels player, and I meet a lot of problem when trying to cut off the thrust of the engines by pressing X but failed to make it to 0. So, is it possible to make a mod to auto-detect the throttle and  shutdown the current-running engines whose minThrust is above 0 when throttle is 0  and  auto-restart them when throttle is not 0?

Also, I meet some problem when throttling with engines whose minThrust above 0, so is it possible to modify the throttling method to place the real throttle in its place? For example, if an engine's minThrust is 50% the maxThrust, you can throttle like an engine with no thrust limit when throttle is above 50%, and thrust locked to 50% when throttle is between 50% and 0%, then a complete shutdown when throttle is 0%.

It could be useful for RealismOverhaul and RealFuels players, and even some stock players.

----

@NathanKell Is it possible now?
